description: Ms. codex. Title from text on leaf 2b, line 10. Physical description: 23 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Extensive marginal notes on some leaves. First few leaves stained and ragged; remainder of manuscript mildly stained. Origin: 16th century? Incipit: الحمد لله الذي شرع الاسلام وسهل شرايعه للواردين
author: Shahīd al-Awwal, Muḥammad ibn Makkī, 1333 or 1334-1380
abstract: Treatise on Shiʻite law. Contains Kitāb al-ṭahārah through Kitāb al-ṣalāh and is incomplete at end; preceded by a fihrist on leaf 1b.
extent: 444 leaves : paper ; 239 x 168 (161 x 81) mm bound to 239 x 168 mm
title: Dhikrá al-Shīʻah fī aḥkām al-sharīʻah.
creator: شهيد الاول، محمد بن مكي، 1333 or 1334-1380
subject: Islamic law—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Orange paper over boards; blue paper doublures.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
